research_questions.question: Are Richard Johnson (1624), William Johnson (1653), and Michael Johnson (d.1718) related?
research_questions.evidence_for: All in same geographic area (Arrowhattocks/Henrico); connected to same allied families (Hatchers, Jordans, Bayleys, Burtons); Richard Johnson and William Hatcher served as Tobacco Viewers together (1639), and William Hatcher's family later neighbors Michael Johnson
research_questions.evidence_against: No document explicitly states any family relationship; common surname; 94-year span from Richard (1624) to Michael's death (1718)
research_questions.research_action: Search for any wills, deeds, or court records naming parent-child relationships among these Johnsons

research_questions.question: Were John Johnson and James Johnson sons of Michael Johnson?
research_questions.evidence_for: 1718 patents show them as adjacent landowners to Michael; 1719 estate inventory shows John and James presenting Michael's estate together; adjacent land patterns typical of father-son
research_questions.evidence_against: No document explicitly states 'son of Michael Johnson'; no will from Michael naming children
research_questions.research_action: Find Michael Johnson's will if it exists; check Henrico court records for guardianship or orphan records

research_questions.question: Was John Jones Michael Johnson's brother-in-law?
research_questions.evidence_for: Listed together on Edloe Plantation tithables 1702; moved together from New Kent County; Tony's consistent claim
research_questions.evidence_against: No document states the relationship; could be neighbors/associates without family tie
research_questions.research_action: Find marriage record for John Jones; check if he married a Watson (sister of Sarah Watson) or a Johnson (sister of Michael)

research_questions.question: Was Alice Watson (wife of John Watson) previously married to Henry Rowen?
research_questions.evidence_for: Tony notes 'Benjamin Hatcher is one of the signeders of John Watson's will 2nd husband of Alice first married to Henry Rowen'; 1661 deed shows Henry Rowing and wife Alice selling to Hatchers
research_questions.evidence_against: Alice is a common name; no document explicitly states Alice Rowen remarried John Watson
research_questions.research_action: Find Henry Rowen's death record or will; find John Watson's marriage record; determine if Alice in both records is same person

research_questions.question: Did Michael Johnson appear in records as early as 1685?
research_questions.evidence_for: Tony claims 1685 Hatcher-Burton deed mentions 'adjoining Michael Johnson and John Johnson'
research_questions.evidence_against: Tony notes 'Lost the Original document on this I need the proof on this deed'; extracted excerpt only shows witnesses, not land description
research_questions.research_action: Locate original 1685 Edward Hatcher to Robert Burton deed in Henrico County Deeds 1677-1705; examine full land description

research_questions.question: What is the source for Michael Johnson at Beaverdam Swamp in 1698?
research_questions.evidence_for: Tony states 'Michael Johnson in 1698 was living by Beaverdam Swamp'
research_questions.evidence_against: First PRIMARY SOURCE for Michael Johnson is 1702 St. Peters Parish vestry entry; 1698 reference appears to be Tony's interpretation
research_questions.research_action: Ask Tony for source of 1698 claim; check St. Peters Parish records pre-1702; check New Kent County records 1695-1702

research_questions.question: What happened to Michael Johnson between 1702 and 1714?
research_questions.evidence_for: N/A - this is a gap in the record
research_questions.research_action: Check Henrico County tithables 1703-1713; check St. Peters Parish records; check New Kent County records; Watson Will (1702) and first land patent (1714) are only known records in this period

research_questions.question: Did Richard Johnson own land at Arrowhattocks before William Johnson's 1653 patent?
research_questions.evidence_for: Tony states William Johnson was 'on lands that once belonged to Richard Johnson'
research_questions.evidence_against: No patent or deed found showing Richard Johnson as landowner; 1639 Tobacco Viewer record shows status but not land ownership
research_questions.research_action: Search Cavaliers and Pioneers for any Richard Johnson patent pre-1653; check Henrico deed books

research_questions.question: Was William Farrar the transporter of Richard Johnson in 1621?
research_questions.evidence_for: Tony states 'Farrar brought Richard Johnson in 1621 to Colonial Va'; 1624 muster places them together at Jordan's Journey
research_questions.research_action: Check Ferrar/Farrar headright claims; examine ship manifests for 1621; verify in Hotten's Original Lists

research_questions.question: Are the 1653 William Johnson (patentee) and 1685 Will Johnson (witness) the same person?
research_questions.evidence_for: Same general area; 32-year span is plausible for one lifetime
research_questions.evidence_against: Could be father/son or unrelated; no explicit connection documented
research_questions.research_action: Look for death record for William Johnson of 1653; check for William Johnson Jr. or son named William

research_questions.question: Was William Burton the son of Robert Burton Sr.?
research_questions.evidence_for: Tony states 'William Burton is son of Robert Burton of Arrowhattocks and Lily Valley'; 1717 patent shows 'William Burton's line' adjacent to Robert Burton's grant
research_questions.evidence_against: No will or deed explicitly naming relationship found
research_questions.research_action: Find Robert Burton Sr.'s will; check Henrico court records for Burton family documentation

research_questions.question: What is the relationship between John Burton (1665 Longfield patent) and Robert Burton Sr. (1699 patent)?
research_questions.evidence_for: Same surname; same area (Longfield/Cornelius Creek); overlapping time period
research_questions.evidence_against: No document states relationship; could be brothers, father/son, cousins, or unrelated
research_questions.research_action: Research Burton family genealogy; find wills or deeds showing family connections

research_questions.question: Are Edward Johnson, Luke Johnson, and John Johnson of Strawberry Banks related to Michael Johnson?
research_questions.evidence_for: Same general area and time period; Tony mentions them in same document
research_questions.evidence_against: Different specific location (Strawberry Banks vs. Tuckahoe Creek); no documented connection
research_questions.research_action: Track these Johnsons separately; look for any documents connecting them to Michael Johnson's family

research_questions.question: Is Charles Johnson (1756 tithables) a descendant of Michael Johnson?
research_questions.evidence_for: Same county (Henrico); timing consistent with grandson generation (born c.1720 if Michael's grandson)
research_questions.research_action: Trace John Johnson and James Johnson descendants to see if any named Charles; check Henrico records 1740-1760
